name: Seaside Jawari
description: Tanpura synth by Seaside Modular based on the open source Jawari VCV Rack module. It simulates the tanpura, an Indian drone instrument with four strings typically played in sequence within a continuous loop. Each strum advances to and plays the next string. The second, third, and fourth strings are tuned in octaves (fourth string an octave below the others), while the first string is often tuned to the fifth of the scale. Microtuning support allows tuning strings to just intervals for an authentic sound.
gui_description: The display shows the tuning of the four strings, with the last string played highlighted.

parameters.name: Bridge shape
parameters.description: Sets the blend between the raw string pluck and a comb filtered version.

parameters.name: Tuning (1st string)
parameters.description: Sets the tuning of the first string, in semitones above the fourth string.

parameters.name: Transpose
parameters.description: Transposes the whole instrument.

parameters.name: Fine tune
parameters.description: Fine tuning control for the whole instrument.

parameters.name: Strum (parameter)
parameters.description: Causes a strum when changed from 0 to 1.

parameters.name: Reset
parameters.description: Resets the sequence so that the next strum plays the first string.

parameters.name: Velocity
parameters.description: Sets the strum velocity.

parameters.name: Damping
parameters.description: The damping factor for the string model.

parameters.name: Length
parameters.description: The decay time for the string model, in seconds.

parameters.name: Bounce count
parameters.description: The number of bridge bounces after the initial strum.

parameters.name: Strum level
parameters.description: The relative strength of the strum vs the bounces, in percentage.

parameters.name: Bounce level
parameters.description: The relative strength of the bounces vs the strum, in percentage.

parameters.name: Start harmonic
parameters.description: The emphasised harmonic at the start of the bounces.

parameters.name: End harmonic
parameters.description: The emphasised harmonic at the end of the bounces.

parameters.name: Strum type
parameters.description: The shape of the initial strum applied to the string model: Flat (0) or Ramped (1).

parameters.name: Strum trigger bus
parameters.description: The bus to use for a strum trigger.

parameters.name: Bridge shape CV bus
parameters.description: The bus to use for CV control over the bridge shape.

parameters.name: Reset trigger bus
parameters.description: The bus to use for a reset trigger.

parameters.name: V/oct main pitch control bus
parameters.description: The bus to use for pitch control over the instrument as a whole.

parameters.name: V/oct 1st string tuning bus
parameters.description: The bus to use for pitch control over the tuning of the first string.

input_ports.name: Strum input bus
input_ports.description: Input bus for strum trigger signals.

input_ports.name: Bridge shape CV bus (input)
input_ports.description: CV control input for bridge shape blending.

output_ports.name: Output bus
output_ports.description: The main audio output bus of the instrument.

output_ports.name: Microtuning outputs (if applicable)
output_ports.description: (Not explicitly detailed in provided documentation, but implied as part of standard microtuning parameters.)
